abstract.p: Ann Calandro letter suggests eating healthy breakfast at home rather than fat-laden fare offered at chain restaurants (Jan 10 article)

block.p: Whatever happened to drinking some O.J. and eating a slice of whole-wheat toast or a bowl of whole-grain cereal before venturing out for coffee? (''The Breakfast Wars,'' Jan. 10).

Presumably we all know enough about the connection between diet and health to know that store-bought pastries and egg and cheese sandwiches are not the foundation of any healthy eating plan. More people are heavier than ever; Type 2 diabetes is on the rise; diet books are best sellers.
